title: Quantum Mechanics and Atomic Structure

vocab.definition: Principle stating position and momentum cannot be precisely known simultaneously
Mathematical equation describing quantum mechanical wave functions
Distribution of electrons among atomic orbitals
Quantum number describing intrinsic angular momentum of particles
Principle that no two electrons can have identical quantum states

teachingNotes: Introduce fundamental quantum principles and their implications. Practice electron configuration notation.

sample.question: What principle states position and momentum cannot be known precisely together?

truefalse.question: The Pauli exclusion principle prevents electrons from having identical quantum states.

multiplechoice.question: What describes the distribution of electrons among orbitals?

fillintheblank.question: The quantum number describing particle spin is the ________ quantum number.

shortanswer.question: What does the Schrödinger equation describe?
